metadata.feature_description: Select the default landing page for group spaces from dynamically loaded group tabs.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify dropdown populates with available group tabs

steps.expected: Community Settings page loads with Group Home Page section visible
steps.actual: Community Settings page loaded successfully showing Influence section and Miscellaneous Community Settings

steps.action: Clicked on Group Home Page dropdown to expand options
steps.expected: Dropdown shows all available group tab options
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing 8 options: Activity, Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Members, Wiki

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Select a group home page from dropdown

steps.action: Selected 'Activity' from the Group Home Page dropdown (original value was 'Wiki')
steps.actual: Dropdown successfully changed to show 'Activity' as the selected value

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save group home page selection and verify persistence

steps.action: Clicked Save button to save the settings
steps.expected: Settings save successfully with confirmation message
steps.actual: Success message 'Item successfully saved.' appeared confirming the save operation

steps.action: Navigated away to Site Settings and returned to Community Settings
steps.expected: Group Home Page dropdown should retain the saved value 'Activity'
steps.actual: Upon returning to Community Settings, the Group Home Page dropdown correctly showed 'Activity' as selected, confirming persistence

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify multiple group tabs available in dropdown

steps.action: Examined the Group Home Page dropdown options
steps.expected: Multiple group tab options should be available
steps.actual: 8 group tab options available: Activity, Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Members, Wiki

observations: Default value verification (0 - no selection) for new installations cannot be tested via UI without creating a fresh installation. Code analysis shows: groupHomePage: ko.observable(0) sets default to 0, and API returns GroupHomePage defaulting to 0 for new installations.
The dropdown dynamically loads group page options from the GroupPages collection returned by the GetSettings API.
All 8 standard group page types are available: Activity, Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Members, Wiki.
Settings persist correctly across page navigation and are saved via the SaveSettings API endpoint.
